answers.answer: Are they afraid of pre eclampsia or gestational diabetes?? I ended up with gestational diabetes with my daughter (she's 3 now) at 34 weeks. They caught it late and that was probably a main issue why I had such horrible morning sickness with her up to 30 + wks pregnant. I had to monitor my keytones and ended up having to due insulin shots bc even with journaling my food and eating how they wanted me to, my body was just not producing enough insulin nor breaking down sugars like it should. I'd ask questions, try not to stress (super hard I know) they will figure out how to help you. Thinking postive for you!! My baby is 3!! I disliked my pregnancy yet she was beyond worth every bit of it.
If you have diabetes its normal to spill ketones which is why you had to monitor them, however ketones in urine is also a sign of dehydration/ malnutrition.
Gotcha.. I wouldn't be worried to get hydrated and I heard dr can prescribe medicine for the bad nausea as well to help..
There just worried about me being too dehydrated.. ive got to get some meds off docs to see if they help me keep food down and sort me out

Im sorry honey, Ive been in and out of the hospital myself 3 times with this pregnancy. I had to have fluids every time. Just stay calm and know your baby is worth it. Im 16wks+4 and I still have morning sickness. This is my first, even though its hard, youre stronger than you realize :) Good luck to you.
Just abit worried as this is my second baby didnt have any sickness with my son and I just feel so ill all the time :( trying to stay positive
